item.title: Quadratic Approximation for a Proportion
item.description: This notebook demonstrates the advantage of working with a transformed parameter when making a quadratic approximation (i.e. an approximation to the probability density function by a Gaussian distribution). If, for example, the parameter to estimate is a proportion and therefore bound to the interval $[0,1]$, it might be difficult to fit a Gaussian, where a significant amount of probability mass might lie in the tails and outside of $[0,1]$. To overcome this we can consider a transformed parameter which is supported on the whole real line, make our approximation, find whatever summary statistic we are interested in, and then transform it back to the original scale.
